newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: Low liquidity pushes Saudi interbank deposits up.
newsitem.headline: Low liquidity pushes Saudi interbank deposits up.

text.p: The spot Saudi riyal was steady against the dollar but a tight market pushed some interbank deposit rates up in active trade this week, dealers said.
"Dealing focused on forwards. Short liquidity in the short dates pushed the rates around 1/16 point higher," one said.

Spot-next and one-week deposits were quoted at 5-5/8, 1/2 percent. One month deposits were at 5-1/2, 3/8 percent, three months at 5-11/16, 9/16 percent, six months at 5-7/8, 3/4 percent and one-year funds were at 6-1/8, six percent.
The spot riyal was put at 3.7505/07 to the dollar.
